definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: When I go dhave the long steep Road of Darkness.
sentences.chinese: 當我行走在黑暗而險峻的路上。

sentences.english: Shapeshifting will no longer cancel Water Walking.
The dirt roads were, at times, impassible because of the heavy tropical rains.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，熱帶暴雨讓泥路無法行走。

sentences.english: Have you ever seen a one -legged dog making its way down the street?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾見過一隻在街上默默行走的的獨腳小狗？

sentences.english: Our closest relatives straightened their backs and began walking upright on two legs.
sentences.chinese: 人類的祖先伸直了後肢開始直立行走。

sentences.english: The bear even made its way to a car dealer's lot.
sentences.chinese: 這隻熊甚至在汽車供銷商的地盤行走。

sentences.english: The result is a pair of "robotic trousers" that he calls ReWalk.
sentences.chinese: 其結果是一條他稱爲“重新行走”的“機器褲子”。

sentences.english: A child was toddling along the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 一個小孩正沿着人行道蹣跚行走。

sentences.english: Chinese astronaut has become the first in his country's history to take a space walk.
sentences.chinese: 中國完成了中國航天史上第一次太空行走。

sentences.english: This is the age at which they can wander and be induced to travel the wrong road.
sentences.chinese: 這是年齡，他們可以漫步和被誘導出行走錯路。

sentences.english: He goes out in the rain, he walks in the water, he travels in winter.
sentences.chinese: 他常在下雨時出門，在水裏行走，在嚴冬旅行。

sentences.english: The crust on the snow was thick enough for us to walk on it.
sentences.chinese: 外層的雪已經凍硬，可以在上面行走。

sentences.english: We walked for miles along the endless beach.
sentences.chinese: 我們沿着那綿遠的海灘行走了數公里。

sentences.english: As l struggled through the snowdrifts, l had just about reached the lowest Point in my life.
sentences.chinese: 處在人生低谷的我在暴風雪中艱難地行走着。

sentences.english: Visitors may see deer walking in the road.
sentences.chinese: 遊客們可能會看到鹿子在公路上行走。

sentences.english: Walk in the sun, do not forget preparing for the dark.
sentences.chinese: 在陽光下行走，勿忘準備迎接黑暗。

definition: to go through/to bore through/to push one's way through
to travel back and forth/to shuttle
to wander about unhurriedly/to linger/to loiter
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
